title: 103_hr2289
content: The Office of Government Ethics Authorization Act of 1994 may be cited as the Gift Acceptance Authority. Section 403 of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 is amended to authorize the Director to accept and utilize gifts, donations, bequests, or services to aid the work of the Office of Government Ethics. No gift may be accepted. Government Ethics - No gift may be accepted if it violates laws or regulations, or requires the use of funds not available to the Office of Government Ethics. The Director will establish rules for determining the acceptance of contributions of money, services, facilities, or personal property. The acceptance of gifts, facilities, or personal property by the Office of Government Ethics or any employee could compromise integrity or appearance of integrity in programs or official duties. The Ethics in Government Act of 1978 is amended to extend authorization of appropriations. Authorized funds are to be appropriated for specific purposes outlined in the Act for fiscal years 1995 to 2002. The Act becomes effective on October 1, 1994. The "Office of Government Ethics Authorization Act of 1994" is cited as the short title. Amendments to the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 are made. The "Office of Government Ethics Authorization Act of 1994" makes amendments to the Ethics in Government Act of 1978, including reauthorization of funding and changes to assistance from other agencies and gift acceptance authority. The "Office of Government Ethics Authorization Act of 1994" amends Section 403 to grant the Director authority to accept gifts, donations, bequests, or devises for the Office's work, with conditions outlined for acceptance. The Director of the Office of Government Ethics can accept gifts under certain conditions, with rules established to ensure acceptance does not compromise the office's integrity. Section 408 reporting deadline is changed to April 30, and the heading for section 401 is amended. The Act eliminates the display requirement for the Code of Ethics for Government Service and amends the Federal Deposit Insurance Act. The effective date of the Act is October 1, 1994.
